summary: Sansa Stark and the Queen of Roses
title: Sansa Stark and the Queen of Roses
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2Xcq0hj

by aheshke

Sansa Stark finds refuge from Joffrey Baratheon in the Hogwarts Library. Margaery Tyrell finds a new studying partner.

Bullet point fic, central Sansaery relationship with other ships lurking in the background.

Words: 1257, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms, Game of Thrones (TV)
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/F, Multi
  • Characters: Sansa Stark, Margaery Tyrell, Loras Tyrell, Renly Baratheon, Arya Stark, Robb Stark, Bran Stark, Rickon Stark, Ned Stark, Catelyn Tully Stark, Jon Snow, Ygritte, Joffrey Baratheon, Tywin Lannister, Olenna Tyrell, Daenerys Targaryen, Jaime Lannister, Tyrion Lannister, Brienne of Tarth
  • Relationships: Sansa Stark/Margaery Tyrell, Renly Baratheon/Loras Tyrell, Arya Stark/Gendry Waters, Robb Stark/Daenerys Targaryen, Jaime Lannister/Brienne of Tarth, Jon Snow/Ygritte
  • Additional Tags: Alternate Universe - Harry Potter Setting, Alternate Universe - Everyone Lives/Nobody Dies, Alternate Universe - Age Changes, Triwizard Tournament, Mutual Pining, margaery and loras are twins, we need more wlw fics, yes this fic is all bullet points deal with it, Sansaery is my OTP

by TannerWuuut

The Stark kids are returning home from college for a surprise reason!

or

Ned and Cat are confused when all their kids are coordinating with each other to come home for what should be a routine visit.

Words: 1228, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Categories: F/F, F/M, M/M, Multi

blog.name: leopoldfitz
blog.title: puking rainbows
blog.description:
Shruti, 25. * [current: various books, theon/sansa & game of thrones]
(sideblog of thesushimonster)

question: Theonsa 52
answer:
+ “Have Fun”

“This isn’t too much, right?”

Sansa is pointing wildly to her dress - which, frankly, Theon couldn’t care less about, given that it’s Sansa in it - face slightly panicked. In his humble opinion, everything Sansa did was too much - she was much too bright, much too beautiful, much too kind, much too stunning… but Theon figures that’s because he’s much too in love with her.

“It’s not too much,” he says about her black dress; it’s tight and a bit short, sure, but Sansa looks happy and confident in it. He puts down the book he’s reading, sticking his phone in between the pages to mark his spot. “You’re doing drinks with your sister and… that woman, right?”

His joke does its job in distracting her because Sansa grins. “Yes, Arya and Margaery and I are going to Highgarden. Marg keeps waxing on and on about how much fun it is, so I finally gave in.” Sansa takes one last glance at the bathroom mirror, doing something with her lips and the red lipstick he plans on thoroughly messing up when she gets back.

Pulling on her heels, some glittery, silver purse under her arm, Sansa gestures to the book in his lap. “Are you just gonna read all night?”

“Might call Yara, catch-up.” Theon leans back on the couch, an ankle resting on the other knee. “It’s been a long week. Need to relax.”

Sansa smiles as she stands taller, sky-high heels on, and walks towards him. If his eyes flicker down to her legs - miles of skin just in front of him - no one can really blame him. Sansa leans forward, giving him a lovely view of her cleavage, before she lifts his chin so their eyes are locked. “Don’t relax too much. I’ll expect to help when I come back.”

“I absolutely cannot wait. Have fun.” Theon grins when she gives him a quick peck, careful not to ruin her makeup. Theon, however, has no such qualms; before Sansa can move away, he grabs the back of her neck and kisses her. Heat, passion, his heart in her soul… and then when he separates, her lipstick a little smeared and her eyes fluttering, Theon smirks. “But not too much fun.”

Sansa clears her throat but her tiny glare is not at all scary. In reality, it only makes Theon more determined to wait up for her. She wipes at the corner of his mouth - probably to clean the remnants of her lipstick - before straightening. “I make no promises.”

And Sansa walks out with her head held high, only looking back to wink at him before shutting the door closed.

Damn, he loves her.

blog.name: leopoldfitz
blog.title: puking rainbows
blog.description:
Shruti, 25. * [current: various books, theon/sansa & game of thrones]
(sideblog of thesushimonster)

question: #12 from the 'ILY' prompt please? :)
answer:
+ when we lay together on the fresh spring grass

Sansa finds him under the shade of a tree, leaning against its trunk, sunglasses over his eyes and arms crossed. With messy hair and baggy t-shirt, Theon looks like he’s lost and misplaced… except the picnic blanket he sits on is bright pink and there’s a spread of food and lemonade spread out before him.

She nudges his foot. When Theon doesn’t move, she rolls her eyes. “Don’t pretend to be asleep.”

“I’m not pretending.” Sighing, Sansa crosses her arms and stands above him without replying, tapping her foot. He lowers his shades to peek an eye out at her. “You’re in my sun.”

“You’re in the shade.”

Theon drops his hand. “What do you want?” he says, not really annoyed and mostly resigned. “Or does - ”

“Scoot over.” Sansa doesn’t know what makes her want to stay here, beside Theon, but it’s a better option than returning to the rest of the picnic - her siblings are playing an intense game of ultimate frisbee that she wants no part of. She is, however, surprised that Theon is here and not there. Theon hesitates for a second but moves over, letting her sink down beside him and rest on the trunk. “So why aren’t you playing?”

Theon drags the container of cookies closer to him. Wordlessly, he hands Sansa a white chocolate macadamia nut - her favorite - before biting into a double chocolate chunk. “Not in the mood,” he says after swallowing.

It’s not really an answer, and they both know it. “You wanna talk about it?”

“No.”

So Sansa leans her head against his shoulder instead. He freezes, for just a moment, but then relaxes, his arm snaking around her waist. Leaving a kiss at her temple, he lingers in her hair. “Someone could see,” he whispers.

Sansa smiles. “Let them.” She moves closer, so her leg rests on top of his, her hand resting on his chest now as she curls into him. “I’m tired and you’re quite the pillow.”

“Seems like a flimsy excuse.” When she nips at his shirt, he chuckles. “Right, no arguing.”

“Hmm, glad you’ve learned that after only a few weeks.”

“A few weeks?” Theon lifts his head and Sansa looks up. “I learned that years ago.”

She feels her forehead wrinkling. “We weren’t dating years ago.” There’s a very long pause - in which she thinks she hears his heart beat faster - before the realization sinks in. “Theon… how long - ”

“Long enough.” His voice is steady, but she can feels his grip tighten around her waist. Sitting up straighter, Sansa brings their faces closer and Theon’s voice softens. “Long enough to know you deserve - ”

Instead of letting him finish - because Sansa knows exactly what he’s going to say, and she’s still working on ridding him of that particular thought - she kisses him. Light and soft, but no less filled - filled with affection and comfort and all the feelings he evokes in her. Theon kisses her back, a tad desperate and a tad relieved. Smiling into his lips, Sansa moves to kiss his cheek and his shoulder before taking back her spot curled into his chest. 

Theon accepts her response and she feels him grinning into her hair instead.

“You’re in the shade.”

Theon drops his hand. “What do you want?” he says, not really annoyed and mostly resigned. “Or does - ”

“Scoot over.” Sansa doesn’t know what makes her want to stay here, beside Theon, but it’s a better option than returning to the rest of the picnic - her siblings are playing an intense game of ultimate frisbee that she wants no part of. She is, however, surprised that Theon is here and not there. Theon hesitates for a second but moves over, letting her sink down beside him and rest on the trunk. “So why aren’t you playing?”

Theon drags the container of cookies closer to him. Wordlessly, he hands Sansa a white chocolate macadamia nut - her favorite - before biting into a double chocolate chunk. “Not in the mood,” he says after swallowing.

It’s not really an answer, and they both know it. “You wanna talk about it?”

“No.”

So Sansa leans her head against his shoulder instead. He freezes, for just a moment, but then relaxes, his arm snaking around her waist. Leaving a kiss at her temple, he lingers in her hair. “Someone could see,” he whispers.

Sansa smiles. “Let them.” She moves closer, so her leg rests on top of his, her hand resting on his chest now as she curls into him. “I’m tired and you’re quite the pillow.”

“Seems like a flimsy excuse.” When she nips at his shirt, he chuckles. “Right, no arguing.”

“Hmm, glad you’ve learned that after only a few weeks.”

“A few weeks?” Theon lifts his head and Sansa looks up. “I learned that years ago.”

She feels her forehead wrinkling. “We weren’t dating years ago.” There’s a very long pause - in which she thinks she hears his heart beat faster - before the realization sinks in. “Theon… how long - ”

“Long enough.” His voice is steady, but she can feels his grip tighten around her waist. Sitting up straighter, Sansa brings their faces closer and Theon’s voice softens. “Long enough to know you deserve - ”

Instead of letting him finish - because Sansa knows exactly what he’s going to say, and she’s still working on ridding him of that particular thought - she kisses him. Light and soft, but no less filled - filled with affection and comfort and all the feelings he evokes in her. Theon kisses her back, a tad desperate and a tad relieved. Smiling into his lips, Sansa moves to kiss his cheek and his shoulder before taking back her spot curled into his chest. 

Theon accepts her response and she feels him grinning into her hair instead.

trail.content_raw:
+ when we lay together on the fresh spring grass

Sansa finds him under the shade of a tree, leaning against its trunk, sunglasses over his eyes and arms crossed. With messy hair and baggy t-shirt, Theon looks like he’s lost and misplaced… except the picnic blanket he sits on is bright pink and there’s a spread of food and lemonade spread out before him.

She nudges his foot. When Theon doesn’t move, she rolls her eyes. “Don’t pretend to be asleep.”

“I’m not pretending.” Sighing, Sansa crosses her arms and stands above him without replying, tapping her foot. He lowers his shades to peek an eye out at her. “You’re in my sun.”

“You’re in the shade.”

Theon drops his hand. “What do you want?” he says, not really annoyed and mostly resigned. “Or does - ”

“Scoot over.” Sansa doesn’t know what makes her want to stay here, beside Theon, but it’s a better option than returning to the rest of the picnic - her siblings are playing an intense game of ultimate frisbee that she wants no part of. She is, however, surprised that Theon is here and not there. Theon hesitates for a second but moves over, letting her sink down beside him and rest on the trunk. “So why aren’t you playing?”

Theon drags the container of cookies closer to him. Wordlessly, he hands Sansa a white chocolate macadamia nut - her favorite - before biting into a double chocolate chunk. “Not in the mood,” he says after swallowing.

It’s not really an answer, and they both know it. “You wanna talk about it?”

“No.”

So Sansa leans her head against his shoulder instead. He freezes, for just a moment, but then relaxes, his arm snaking around her waist. Leaving a kiss at her temple, he lingers in her hair. “Someone could see,” he whispers.

Sansa smiles. “Let them.” She moves closer, so her leg rests on top of his, her hand resting on his chest now as she curls into him. “I’m tired and you’re quite the pillow.”

“Seems like a flimsy excuse.” When she nips at his shirt, he chuckles. “Right, no arguing.”

“Hmm, glad you’ve learned that after only a few weeks.”

“A few weeks?” Theon lifts his head and Sansa looks up. “I learned that years ago.”

She feels her forehead wrinkling. “We weren’t dating years ago.” There’s a very long pause - in which she thinks she hears his heart beat faster - before the realization sinks in. “Theon… how long - ”

“Long enough.” His voice is steady, but she can feels his grip tighten around her waist. Sitting up straighter, Sansa brings their faces closer and Theon’s voice softens. “Long enough to know you deserve - ”

Instead of letting him finish - because Sansa knows exactly what he’s going to say, and she’s still working on ridding him of that particular thought - she kisses him. Light and soft, but no less filled - filled with affection and comfort and all the feelings he evokes in her. Theon kisses her back, a tad desperate and a tad relieved. Smiling into his lips, Sansa moves to kiss his cheek and his shoulder before taking back her spot curled into his chest. 

Theon accepts her response and she feels him grinning into her hair instead.

blog.name: dhaarunispeaks
blog.title: Deceptively Complicated
blog.description:
<!-- Statcounter code for Dhaarunispeaks.tumblr.com
http://dhaarunispeaks.tumblr.com on Tumblr -->
 
 
 
<!-- End of Statcounter Code -->

summary: (1) All these folks bitching about Daenerys not ruling Westeros while mad about Sansa saying she “doesn’t fight or do anything...
question: (1) All these folks bitching about Daenerys not ruling Westeros while mad about Sansa saying she “doesn’t fight or do anything useful,” have no idea what it means to rule a country in everyday life. Ruling isn’t about fighting in battles, having the biggest armies or making big shows. It’s about governing the people and the areas around you. Making sure the people and the society is safe and as well cared for as possible.
answer:
(2) Sansa caring about the opinions of her people, even if she doesn’t necessarily agree ? Her fighting for the independence of her people who she knows have gone through hell and back ? Sansa addressing the issues of food because she knows what starvation does to people ? Sansa insisting on keeping the gates open to allow more refugees into Winterfell ? Those “boring, useless” things are all the traits of a good, everyday ruler. A ruler doesn’t need to know how to fight or go to war.

(3) Tywin was an evil war criminal, but he spoke wise words to Tommen. A good ruler knows what they know and what they don’t. Sansa said before she doesn’t know anything about battles, but that’s OKAY. She doesn’t HAVE to. She would have counselors for that. Those on her team who DO know and who will fight on behalf of her. Nobody knows everything, but it seems to me that someone waving a sword around is seen as better ruler material than understanding how to solve everyday issues.

(4) It’s like GRRM said: But Tolkien doesn’t ask the question: “What was Aragorn’s tax policy ? Did he maintain a standing army ? What did he do in times of flood and famine ? And what about all these orcs ?” What has Daenerys ever done to show she is capable of this kind of everyday governance ? Meanwhile, Sansa was constantly showing this kind of reliability. Its “boring” but it’s necessary. It’s not flashy, but its realistic. That’s why she’s a great choice for queen.

(5) Reminds me of Daenery’s quote in s5: “I am not a politician, I’m a queen” (one of the worst quote she ever uttered to be praised by the fans (YASSS KWEEN) right after Hizdhar told her politics is about compromise, she was set to fail a long time ago, because in her vision of ruling, she didn’t need politics, ruling = conquering for Daenerys, that’s why she failed in Meereen, because she doesn’t have an understanding of politics and didn’t want to have an understanding.

Omg I HATE the “I’m not a politician, I’m a queen” line too! If she wants to rule, she’d better learn politics or at least listen to her advisors who she increasingly ignores as the series goes on!

The Boltons ruled the North on fear, not consent of the governed which is why the people of the North’s loyalties truly lay with the Starks and I’m sorry to make this comparison but Dany’s methods are not dissimilar. I’m not saying she’s a sociopath or a psychopath or whatever Ramsay is but she definitely uses fear a la threatening people with death by fire (the most painful way in universe to die!) to conquer cities rather than gaining support organically through her actions and behavior. Daario #2 (the significantly hotter Daario) was right when he called her a conqueror not a queen way back in like Season 4! In the books, her actions come across as more naive than ruthless but in the show, because she’s aged up, she also is less sympathetic much earlier on than in the books. 

The reason Sansa is and will continue to be a good ruler is quite simply that she genuinely cares for the well-being of her people. I think she’s going to be a better leader than Ned or Robb or even Jon because she prioritizes the day to day needs of those who chose her as their leader, making sure they’re safe and warm and not hungry, without fixating on the “greater good” and waging wars and as you said, maybe that’s not the kind of thing fancy cinematography is made for and isn’t cool and flashy but that’s what’s truly important. Saving the world from the forces of evil is all well and good but if all your people don’t have food or shelter, what’s the point of them surviving if they’re going to die immediately after from the cold and starvation anyways?

Sansa addressing the issues of food because she knows what starvation does to people ? Sansa insisting on keeping the gates open to allow more refugees into Winterfell ? Those “boring, useless” things are all the traits of a good, everyday ruler. A ruler doesn’t need to know how to fight or go to war.

(3) Tywin was an evil war criminal, but he spoke wise words to Tommen. A good ruler knows what they know and what they don’t. And what about all these orcs ?” What has Daenerys ever done to show she is capable of this kind of everyday governance ? Meanwhile, Sansa was constantly showing this kind of reliability. Its “boring” but it’s necessary. It’s not flashy, but its realistic. That’s why she’s a great choice for queen.

(5) Reminds me of Daenery’s quote in s5: “I am not a politician, I’m a queen” (one of the worst quote she ever uttered to be praised by the fans (YASSS KWEEN) right after Hizdhar told her politics is about compromise, she was set to fail a long time ago, because in her vision of ruling, she didn’t need politics, ruling = conquering for Daenerys, that’s why she failed in Meereen, because she doesn’t have an understanding of politics and didn’t want to have an understanding.

Omg I HATE the “I’m not a politician, I’m a queen” line too! If she wants to rule, she’d better learn politics or at least listen to her advisors who she increasingly ignores as the series goes on!

The Boltons ruled the North on fear, not consent of the governed which is why the people of the North’s loyalties truly lay with the Starks and I’m sorry to make this comparison but Dany’s methods are not dissimilar. I’m not saying she’s a sociopath or a psychopath or whatever Ramsay is but she definitely uses fear a la threatening people with death by fire (the most painful way in universe to die!) to conquer cities rather than gaining support organically through her actions and behavior. Daario #2 (the significantly hotter Daario) was right when he called her a conqueror not a queen way back in like Season 4! In the books, her actions come across as more naive than ruthless but in the show, because she’s aged up, she also is less sympathetic much earlier on than in the books. 

The reason Sansa is and will continue to be a good ruler is quite simply that she genuinely cares for the well-being of her people. I think she’s going to be a better leader than Ned or Robb or even Jon because she prioritizes the day to day needs of those who chose her as their leader, making sure they’re safe and warm and not hungry, without fixating on the “greater good” and waging wars and as you said, maybe that’s not the kind of thing fancy cinematography is made for and isn’t cool and flashy but that’s what’s truly important. Saving the world from the forces of evil is all well and good but if all your people don’t have food or shelter, what’s the point of them surviving if they’re going to die immediately after from the cold and starvation anyways?
trail.content:
(2) Sansa caring about the opinions of her people, even if she doesn’t necessarily agree ? Her fighting for the independence of her people who she knows have gone through hell and back ? Sansa addressing the issues of food because she knows what starvation does to people ? Sansa insisting on keeping the gates open to allow more refugees into Winterfell ? Those “boring, useless” things are all the traits of a good, everyday ruler. A ruler doesn’t need to know how to fight or go to war.

(3) Tywin was an evil war criminal, but he spoke wise words to Tommen. A good ruler knows what they know and what they don’t. Sansa said before she doesn’t know anything about battles, but that’s OKAY. She doesn’t HAVE to. She would have counselors for that. Those on her team who DO know and who will fight on behalf of her. Nobody knows everything, but it seems to me that someone waving a sword around is seen as better ruler material than understanding how to solve everyday issues.

(4) It’s like GRRM said: But Tolkien doesn’t ask the question: “What was Aragorn’s tax policy ? Did he maintain a standing army ? What did he do in times of flood and famine ? And what about all these orcs ?” What has Daenerys ever done to show she is capable of this kind of everyday governance ? Meanwhile, Sansa was constantly showing this kind of reliability. Its “boring” but it’s necessary. It’s not flashy, but its realistic. That’s why she’s a great choice for queen.

(5) Reminds me of Daenery’s quote in s5: “I am not a politician, I’m a queen” (one of the worst quote she ever uttered to be praised by the fans (YASSS KWEEN) right after Hizdhar told her politics is about compromise, she was set to fail a long time ago, because in her vision of ruling, she didn’t need politics, ruling = conquering for Daenerys, that’s why she failed in Meereen, because she doesn’t have an understanding of politics and didn’t want to have an understanding.

Omg I HATE the “I’m not a politician, I’m a queen” line too! If she wants to rule, she’d better learn politics or at least listen to her advisors who she increasingly ignores as the series goes on!

The Boltons ruled the North on fear, not consent of the governed which is why the people of the North’s loyalties truly lay with the Starks and I’m sorry to make this comparison but Dany’s methods are not dissimilar. I’m not saying she’s a sociopath or a psychopath or whatever Ramsay is but she definitely uses fear a la threatening people with death by fire (the most painful way in universe to die!) to conquer cities rather than gaining support organically through her actions and behavior. Daario #2 (the significantly hotter Daario) was right when he called her a conqueror not a queen way back in like Season 4! In the books, her actions come across as more naive than ruthless but in the show, because she’s aged up, she also is less sympathetic much earlier on than in the books. 

The reason Sansa is and will continue to be a good ruler is quite simply that she genuinely cares for the well-being of her people. I think she’s going to be a better leader than Ned or Robb or even Jon because she prioritizes the day to day needs of those who chose her as their leader, making sure they’re safe and warm and not hungry, without fixating on the “greater good” and waging wars and as you said, maybe that’s not the kind of thing fancy cinematography is made for and isn’t cool and flashy but that’s what’s truly important. Saving the world from the forces of evil is all well and good but if all your people don’t have food or shelter, what’s the point of them surviving if they’re going to die immediately after from the cold and starvation anyways?
